website_summaries.verdict: The AAXA P5 is a palmtop-size LED projector with plenty of ports and a rechargeable battery, but modest brightness and mediocre image quality.
pros: Good port selection for a small projector
cons: Shows scaling artifacts at native resolution
Oversaturated colors and rainbow artifacts in video

customer_reviews.title: Fun mini projector for home and on the road
customer_reviews.text: I love this little LED projector! I thought it would be a toy but I am blown away by the brightness. I bought a 100" screen from elite screens that I can not be any happier for the money. The speakers are pretty good but I hooked it up to an external speaker for the full effect. My friends were blown away when I told him how much everything was. I can't get over how something this mini can be so bright and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Rohhee

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, to blurry to read documents
customer_reviews.text: Got unit for meeting room presentations. Mainly, presenting Word documents and we would go through the document making changes. I was very happy with the brightness of projected image. The fan noise wasn't as bothersome as others indicated, but again, we were in a nosier officer setting. The setup was a few seconds via hdmi cable. Unfortunately the image wasn't clear enough to read the documents on the projected image. The letters/words are too blurred to be able to read them. Tried to use the focus wheel, but even with best "focus" we couldn't make out the words. I was projecting to about 5-6 feet distance. I had to send it back and looking for a projector with clearer/sharper image.
customer_reviews.author: SunsetAir

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: So, I purchased this to serve as a mobile monitor which is a lot to ask from such a product. It's quite good. The focus is somewhat twitchy but I recently traveled with it and it was especially good for practicing a Powerpoint presentation. It's not easy to replicate the function of a large monitor and although its better than 2 others I tried, it's still not really that functional for MS Word. Workable but not optimal. The color is much better than the two other products I tried and there was no problem connecting to my Macbook air.
customer_reviews.author: James Guest

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to use & great quality projection
customer_reviews.text: I just finished my first week of leading training classes with my new P6 projector. I love that it is so light weight, easy to carry with my laptop, through TSA and on my back all week. Also love how easy it is to set up and use. The quality (brightness, clarity, resolution support & projection size) is so much better than the older projector ceiling mounted where I teach. Only warning is that on battery you lose a lot of brightness, but I only needed to do that once, for a quick impromptu demo - how cool to be able to do that!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Framerate not supported / AAXA website is unavailable
customer_reviews.text: I actually kept my Amazon-purchased P6 boxed until today. I easily mounted it on an old tripod I had and plugged in my USB flash drive which is full of homemade music videos. "Framerate not supported" is all I got. I attempted to go to the AAXA website but it's not working. So I have no idea what to do except to randomly re-encode my videos. And the speaker is tiny and the volume adjustment is nonexisten. I suppose the only way you can get decent sound is to plug in amplified speakers.
customer_reviews.author: James Zachary

customer_reviews.title: The price is right!
customer_reviews.text: Ok... I did so much research on these small portable projectors and landed on this one. I'm truly surprised and so happy I decided on this one. It was more than I wanted to spend but, worth every penny! The hardware is solid and the picture is Awesome. Only two improvements could be made. The Tripod they package isn't that sturdy and the battery could last a bit longer. But... I would definitely buy again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Franc Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Small, powerful, bright and quiet
customer_reviews.text: We've used this several times outside now and we are completely impressed. The color, brightness, focus and clarity is amazing, even in not-quiet-dark settings. The fan is very quiet which was a concern of mine. I am not disapoointed and it was worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Clear and bright projection. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This projector is amazing for the cost and the size. It fits nicely in my computer case. I use it for presentations to groups of 10 to 30 people. The projection is easy to see even with some lights on. Text is easy to read. This summer I am planning on movies in the back yard. The controls are easy to figure out and use. The only drawback is it does not work with my USB 'C' to VGA adapter, but It does work with my hdmi adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great mini projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: The picture is great! Out of the mini projectors I tested this is by far the best. The 2 watt speaker is actually really loud and clear. This is a great projector for someone whose life is on the go. Only cons are the pictures reds seem to be too red, even with manipulating the settings. The fan noise on the brightest setting is loud but it was expected. Oh and the tripod stand that comes with this projector is a joke, buy a 3rd party stand.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to make it work.
customer_reviews.text: I took it to Brazil to use at a kids leadership camp and it was useless! We could not make it work Samsung cell phones, laptop and some iPhones. Too hard to make it work and I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Really like the clarity and brightness of this projector
customer_reviews.text: Really like the clarity and brightness of this projector. Works beautifully when paired to my Chromecast. Battery lasts about 1.5 hours. Strongly recommend buying a flexible tripod like the iKross Compact Tripod. We use the projector to watch Netflix and movies on our ceiling in bed.
customer_reviews.author: H. A.

customer_reviews.title: def a good buy. very bright
customer_reviews.text: def a good buy. very bright. no wi fi needed. plug in. be sure to get adapter if using with iphone or ipad, also can buy a stand if dont have a table. the stand it comes with is no good
customer_reviews.author: noel anschutz

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice very small projector
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice very small projector. While it shows pictures and videos fairly well, text was often fuzzy and required refocusing the lens to make it clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark-Frink

customer_reviews.title: Image quality and portability
customer_reviews.text: Excellent projector, good quality, good bright and sharp image. I've used it with Excel, Power Point and Word and it works fine. I recommend it for the classroom as well as for the office. I'm satisfied. Its 600 lumens are sufficient to be used in light environments.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Halloween Projector
customer_reviews.text: Saw some cool youtube videos of people using projectors for their halloween decorations and wanted to replicate it. Ended up using at our school and the students loved it. Just hooked it up to a usb with video and looped it indefinitely. Hooked up external speakers so the zombies were super loud and the experience was amazing. Cant wait till next year when I step this up to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Allen K. Lau

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this projector
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this projector. Very clear at day time and especially at night time. We are enjoying NFL on big screen. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cirej

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it until it overheated twice in the span of 30 minutes and quit working with plenty of ventilation. If the new unit works normally Ill change my review to a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Garrison

customer_reviews.title: A Great projector!
customer_reviews.text: Great picture for a small compact projector! Easy to use and connect. Came with all the connection cables I needed and even a tripod stand. A very good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Magana

customer_reviews.title: Low cost decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Use it for work. Only used a few times, but does what it says. For low cost projector it does a nice job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Gutkind

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get it to work with my laptop. Spoke with customer service 3 times. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Image
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Sound Battery life Does not work with my Iphone Pros: Nice Image Connections
customer_reviews.author: José de Abreu Prado Neto

customer_reviews.title: Clear and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Out of 3 mini projectors tried, this is the only projector that shows clear and readable text, sharp display and has full HDMI support.Good job.
customer_reviews.author: Sasi

customer_reviews.title: Returned the projector
customer_reviews.text: On delivery something was loose inside the unit - I returned it and do not plan on replacing it because of the initial problem - I'll wait until a brand name comes up with a competing unit.
customer_reviews.author: Prefurbia

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: definitely the strongest projector at this size that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: adam m p

customer_reviews.title: Compact great picture
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy set up. We do alot of trainings for pipeline services and I wouldnt use anything else. Would receive mmend to friend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Knowing full well that it was only 300 lumens it has more than met my expectations for performance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Urich

customer_reviews.title: P300 is better
customer_reviews.text: I still prefer and recommend P300 than P6 bcoz it can read large volume of storage (Hard Drive) unlike P6 it cannot
customer_reviews.author: Jerrymil

customer_reviews.title: be extremely careful ...
customer_reviews.text: the small tripod provided with the projector is a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Long T Vu

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: No speakers, but everything else is great. I bought two extra batteries, their site is great and at 25 bucks a pop, worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alcorn

customer_reviews.title: Fine but not Pro
customer_reviews.text: Fine little object with some littles unconfortable things. The focus wheel is hard and an accurate and precise focus is difficoult to get. The menu setting is very limited and there is not a zoom option to adjust the size. Is very bright but colors are not so brilliant. The tripod included in the box is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: marta

customer_reviews.title: The other point is the mini tripod which is useless cause it's so bad that I can't consider using ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything is ok with this projector except three points : The on/off switch button is very small and hard to move. Therefore,I have to use a tool when I want to switch on/switch off. The other point is the mini tripod which is useless cause it's so bad that I can't consider using it. Finally, the connection with the wall charger is terrible and it is always disconnecting just by touching the cable or the device. This is the worst point for me. Otherwise the product is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Lars Pers

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made. The image quality and size (in excess of 100" in a dark room) is fantastic considering the product size and price. The internal speaker is of terrible quality, honestly they should not even include it as an option, but I can't imagine not having a different audio source when using this product. No stars taken away due to the speaker because that's not what this product is primarily for. The focus knob could be a little more precise, as it can be difficult to zero in on the crisp focus point, but it's a minor detraction from the overall quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Otis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Great resolution Small size means I can carry it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Covington

customer_reviews.title: No tripod in the box
customer_reviews.text: The projector itself is nice my problem was in the packaging. It was sold to me as new but it came to me without the tripod! According to the product description it should be included! It looked to me as it was a return and was resealed without checking the contents. Other the that it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Darin Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but the interface is awful and the device loses focus very easily. Also so-so image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting sonething cool, but it turns out to be a garbage
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting sonething cool, but it turns out to be a garbage. The remote controller does not work at all, even after i replaced new batteries; the projector runs with noise like a train. I returned it immediately the very next day.
customer_reviews.author: Shaohu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in its price/size class
customer_reviews.text: I have a few mini projectors, and this performs as well as the best ones in this price point and size. I can use it with my macbook and project and get pretty good display quality. Not enough to wow me ... until I remember that it's about portability and price, not about building out your home theater. It doesn't compare with theater-quality projectors, but it's not trying to. If you need portability and performance, and recognize that this isn't going to give you a retina-display sort of picture, then this is a really great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very bright, but loud and weird red hues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to have an impromptu movie night in the backyard. Pros: It's bright for a pico projector. Manual focus is easy enough to use Cons: The fan sounds like a supersonic jet - not a big deal for backyard viewing, but might in a small conference room. Color: There are some oddly red hues. Most notably when viewing people, they all look just a bit red. It came with it's own tripod, but the tripod is clunky, and almost seems undersized for the unit. Wishlist: I wish it had wifi and bluetooth on board.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Madre

customer_reviews.title: Small and clear
customer_reviews.text: I originally picked this product so I could project hymnals at church, but my daughter has taking a liking to it. It works wonderfully, and there is built in speakers! My daughter uses it for TV instead of An actual tv and it’s amazing
customer_reviews.author: J dog

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Projector!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t Buy This Projector! The resolution is horrible and very difficult to manually focus. Purchased this as a Deal of the Day and it was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: jld1977

customer_reviews.title: Great small battery-powered projector for outdoor movie nights!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small and portable, battery-powered projector I could use when going out camping or to use to watch movies in the backyard with the kids. Brightness is good and the portability is great. With external speakers attached, the movie-watching experience just gets better. I wish the projector had Bluetooth connectivity for the speaker but wired option is not a huge problem for me. The battery lasted long enough to watch a whole movie, which was awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Amazing projector
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and portable, produces very crisp and bright image. Great for business trips!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: AAXA P5 LED Portable Pico Projector, 300 Lumen, 1280x720P HD Resolution, 135 Min Battery, 20,000 Hour LED, Media Player, Business
product_meta.description: Style:P5The AAXA P5 is the World's Smallest 300 Lumen Pico Projector. It revolutionizes mobile projection by mating a lithium ion battery with LED Projection technology. This union creates a no compromise portable projector that can deliver high quality images both plugged in or on battery power. With it's third generation optical system, the P5 features a brilliant 300 Lumen optical engine powered by 20,000 Hour Vibrant Color LEDs and a native HD resolution of 1280x720. This optical power house enables the P5 to deliver vivid 120" displays in dark areas and usable displays in brightly lit areas - a first for mobile projection.
feature_bullets: Ultra-Bright 300 Lumen, 20,000 Hour LED Light Source, Native 1280x720 HD Resolution (WXGA). Powered by Latest DLP Technology.
135 Minute Lithium-Ion Battery with Quick Release. (see product images for more details)
Wide Range of Connectivity: HDMI, Mini-VGA, Micro SD, USB, Composite A/V, and 3.5mm Audio Out.
Onboard Media Player (Video, Picture, Music, and Text). Play Media, Anytime, Anywhere.
Projects up to 120" image (in low-light conditions).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars64 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
